name: RACV Cape Schanck Resort

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised by the resort. It was much nicer than we expected, and our expectations had already been raised by the very positive reviews on Tripadvisor. Loved the boardwalk to breakfast, which was included - a bonus! We thoroughly enjoyed the yummy spread. We could see the sea from our balcony which overlooked some bush and the coast. The games room provided additional entertainment and we wished we'd had time to take a dip in the very inviting pool. The peninsula has so much for young families and with the added comfort of this resort, we are certainly putting Cape Schanck on our list of places to visit again soon!
reviews.title: Wonderful resort - definitely going back again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have lost count how many times we have been to RACV Cape Schanck. It's our little hide away. Short easy trip from Melbourne. Check in quick, friendly and easy. The rooms are clean and comfortable with all the mod cons you require when you're away for a couple of nights. Unpack, sit out on the balcony and have a glass of wine and watch the sun disappear. You would hardly know anyone else was staying there even though they are fully booked.Breakfast staff are so attentive. One restaurant staff member during the breakfast session (Leigh) is the most cheerful person I have ever met without being over the top. If the sun is out sit by the pool and forget everything. Wineries are definitely worth look at. Went to Port Phillip winery this time. Absolutely stunning architecture, tastings and view. Can't wait till next time.
reviews.title: Our little hide away

reviews.text: Stayed for corporate conference and found the resort to be great for what we wanted.
reviews.title: Great for corp conference or couples retreat

reviews.text: Rooms are a long walk or short drive from restauarnt/reception so dont lock your key in the room! Great resort facilities as well.
reviews.title: A great place to stay, relax and play golf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic ocean views, very secluded and quiet.
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations - great service and fantastic, quiet view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we spent 1 night as a treat for ourselves by taking up a tv travel show promotion.1 night dinner, bed and buffet breakfast .a drink each at the bar was also part of the deal. its an easy drive from melbourne down to the mornington peninsula ,follow boneo rd past the market gardens towards the back beach and you are there.turn in through the resort entry and up the meandering rd,great welome at the desk by clementine who explains how the deal works gives you a map -( it is a sizable resort set within a golf course with a few different areas for the accom).hop back in the car and away you go.our room was an ocean view-balcony view out to bass strait across the bush and the national golf course . we had prebooked our dinner reservation so the rest of the stay may be filled in with snooker ,table tennis,golf,tennis or a swim in the outdoor heated pool which sits under the trees and is quite lovely.late checkout was part of our deal and who really wants to leave anywhere at 10.00am?the room was immaculate ,electric blinds-bit too noisy to put up early next morning if you want to see the view,v.comfy bedding, flat screen tv ,small sofa ,desk ,coffee table.bathroom immaculate.our dinner was great, well prepared food modern cuisine ,service wonderful.depending on where your room is you can make your way through the gardens and boardwalk to the restaurant,we ended up at the back of the restaurant where there was an open door went in but you're surrounded by diners eating,a sign outside would be nice directing guests to continue around through either the cafe entry or lobby to the correct restaurant door. .as we had slightly lost our bearings after getting back in the car after check in and driving off we werent too sure where to go. buffet breakfast next day-same restaurant right door this time.nice food, pastries perhaps a bit ordinary.the venue was enjoyed by a mixed bunch of couples of all ages, families with real littlies and groups of friends.the golfers were already out on the course by the time we were up.all good but for the extremely bad service by a lady with the initial s when it was time to check out wasnt good at all.a dispute over the price for dinner even though it was included in the booking and on our paper work, with us to pay for the extra dish and wines only (which we fully expected when we signed the account at dinner )was not good .it was sorted out only by my fellow guest insisting, that she went defensive.perhaps she was got out of bed the wrong way ,management may like to send her on a customer service refresher course.other than that i can highly recommend the venue!
reviews.title: peaceful retreat to treat yourself

reviews.text: Just spent two nights here with family in two villas next to each other.
reviews.title: Good for golf, not bad for other activities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had small kids, other family had a teenager.
reviews.title: Breathaking views, wonderful rooms, great golf, a relaxing break

reviews.text: Golf course - reasonably priced and a good course, make sure you book
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend and loved it. The views from the rooms over the ocean were spectacular. The rooms are clean and tidy. Dinner in the restaurant was very good and not bad value. The included buffet breakfast was excellent. The recreational facilities were OK, although the gym is small with basic equipment. We will definitely be returning.
reviews.title: Great views with good food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms where clean and modern with beautiful ocean views. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We were in a hurry at breakfast to meet our Golf time when a helpful staff member suggested & organised bacon & egg rolls to takeaway and some ice to keep our drinks cold. The peaceful views around the golf course made up for my poor golf efforts (had not played in 5 years). We dined at the restaurant both nights, the food was good and it was only a short walk from our room (although the stairs had gaps & damaged my heels).
reviews.title: Perfect 2 Night Get Away From The Kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean, modern and have a brillant view. We stayed on the Stay and Bath package so breakfast was included and 2 passes to the hot springs. It was brilliant value. We walked to the restaurant to dinner and had a lovely seafood platter for 2. Fresh seafood, nicely cooked. The desserts were very impressive. I had the italian donuts which came salted tofee and choc dipping sauce. Presentation was a fantastic. Felt very spoilt. It's welcoming to children but still okay for a romantic dinner. excellent attentive service and great food. Breakfast the next morning was a treat. Divine chocolate muffins and pastries. Also yummy hot food as well. We have been raving about our break and highly recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: We loved it. Great mini-break

reviews.text: 10 lady friends from Riverside had two fun nights here June 8th and 9th. We were very pleased with the very hospitable staff, who went out of their way to arrange our rooms close together, even though the original booking was is separate areas of the complex. We had units that look across to St Andrews beach. Dinner and breakfast was excellent and the golf course in great shape.
reviews.title: Great golf trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3 nights here while working in the area. We found the accommodation neat and comfortable and the views were beautiful. This is one of the general problems with accommodation on the peninsula - there is very little option for a room with a view!
reviews.title: Beautiful Views and AMAZING Dining Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 2 night stay in a comfortable renovated room with a great view down the Mornington Peninsula. A car is essential as apart from the golf there's nothing much else within walking distance. However, with a car the Cape Schanck reserve (and board-walk) is easily accessible and well worth while (NB $4.50 in coins required to exit the parking area), as well as the wineries, restaurants and other attractions of the Mornington Peninsula.
reviews.title: Great views, pleasant resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sunday evening roast buffet was good, as were the breakfasts. We were surprised when we tried to make a late booking for the Monday pasta evening to be told that it was fully booked - so book early! However, the short trip down the road to the Rosebud pub for a good bistro meal was no hardship.
reviews.title: Nice but leave it to the golfers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A particular feature of the resort is the staff - they were all extremely pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

likes.disliked: — Not being able to walk to the course with golf buggy

reviews.title: Great Resort
reviews.text: Have no doubt that the RACV Cape Schanck is a well run resort. Rooms and beds are good. Breakfast was well up to standard as was the Sunday Night Roast Dinner Buffet. Did not try the a la carte. The recreation and pool facilities are well laid out and enjoyable to use.

aka: Racv Cape Schanck Hotel Cape Schanck
description: Located at the southern-most tip of Victoria’s glorious Mornington Peninsula, RACV Cape Schanck Resort looks out over rugged Bass Strait and Western Port Bay. It’s here that the historic Cape Schanck Lighthouse sits proudly on the rocky headland guiding ships through one of the world’s most dangerous stretches of water into safe harbour. And it’s here that this contemporary resort is set on one of the most striking coastal golf courses in Australia, offering expansive cliff-top views. While the Robert Trent Jones-designed course is ranked one of the top 100 courses in Australia, there’s a lot more to the resort, and the region for that matter, other than golf. With coastal beauty, rolling countryside, some of Victoria’s best Pinot producing wineries, galleries, produce makers and historic villages, the resort is ideally positioned for a weekend of wine tasting, exploring country markets or gazing out across the fairways to the blue Southern Ocean beyond.Our exclusive coastal accommodation in Victoria offers stylish rooms, suites or house size villas decked out in warm, contemporary décor, with luxurious interiors, balconies and every modern convenience. So kick back on your private balcony with a glass of local Pinot Noir, watch a magical sunset and listen to the ocean waves roll in.
